*div1 type="summary"* *p*Austin to members of militia [about May 1, 1826]. Address urging discipline and obedience during campaign against Waco and Tahuacano Indians.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"* *p*[about May 1, 1826.]*/p* *p*F[ellow] S[itizens]*/p*
*p*You are therefore now called upon to protect your own *location_mentioned*homes*/location_mentioned*, your own *location_mentioned*property*/location_mentioned*, to shield your *person_mentioned*wives */person_mentioned*and *person_mentioned*children */person_mentioned*from the arrows of a savage and merciless *person_mentioned*enemy*/person_mentioned*—your adopted *location_mentioned*country */location_mentioned*now also called upon you to rally around the national flag and fight its enemies the *person_mentioned*Wacos */person_mentioned*and *person_mentioned*Tahuacanies*/person_mentioned*—every honorable and ardent impulse Therefore that can animate the bosoms of *person_mentioned*free men*/person_mentioned* burns in yours and urges you forward to meet the *person_mentioned*enemy*/person_mentioned*—the defence of your *location_mentioned*firesides*/location_mentioned*—of your *person_mentioned*wives */person_mentioned*and *person_mentioned*childen*/person_mentioned*, your *person_mentioned*friends*/person_mentioned*—*person_mentioned*yourselves*/person_mentioned*— your *location_mentioned*property */location_mentioned*and your *location_mentioned*country*/location_mentioned*, fellow S. the motives which have caused you to take up arms is a sufficient guarantee that you will use those arms as becomes brave *person_mentioned*men */person_mentioned*fighting in a just cause. You are *person_mentioned*decendants of freemen*/person_mentioned*—the *person_mentioned*decendants of brave soldiers */person_mentioned*also *person_mentioned*Americans*/person_mentioned*—the blood that fills your viens has warmed the hearts of *person_mentioned*those who fought in the American Revolution*/person_mentioned* fought and conquered the *person_mentioned*oppressors */person_mentioned*of American Liberty. Perhaps the spirits of your *person_mentioned*Fathers*/person_mentioned* watch over the conduct of their *person_mentioned*decendants*/person_mentioned*, perhaps their eyes as well as those of your *person_mentioned*friends*/person_mentioned*, your *person_mentioned*countrymen */person_mentioned*and your adopted Govt are upon you They see the great importance of the duties, before you, that the prosperity the safety of an infant and flourishing new *location_mentioned*colony */location_mentioned*depends in a great degree on your bravery and good conduct in this first effort to humble and punish our *person_mentioned*enemies*/person_mentioned*. Shall their hopes, their prairs be disappointed—No. Your conduct since the first commencement of this *location_mentioned*colony*/location_mentioned*, the union and determined spirit that now animates you are guarantees that the only obstacle to your complete tryumph will be the flight of your *person_mentioned*enemies */person_mentioned*before you can find them.*/p* *p*The depradations of your *person_mentioned*enemies */person_mentioned*the *person_mentioned*W. and T. indians*/person_mentioned* and there hostile preparations, has driven us to the necessity of taking up arms in self defence. The *location_mentioned*frontier */location_mentioned*is menaced—The whole *location_mentioned*colony */location_mentioned*is threatened—under these circumstances it became my duty to call the *person_mentioned*militia */person_mentioned*to the *location_mentioned*frontier */location_mentioned*to repel the threatened attacks and to teach our *person_mentioned*enemies */person_mentioned*to fear and respect us.—It is with feelings of the deepest regret that I have yielded to a sense of duty in agreeing not to go out in person on this expedition, not because I think there is any necessity for my presence, or that the *person_mentioned*officers */person_mentioned*who command you will need my aid, but because I wish to share equally with you in all your labors, and all your fatigues in defending this *location_mentioned*colony*/location_mentioned*—but my duty to the *person_mentioned*settlers */person_mentioned*in attending to the unfinished business of the *location_mentioned*Co*/location_mentioned*. and completing the genl system for our defence which is in contemplation to adopt and the wishes of the *person_mentioned*people */person_mentioned*strongly urged upon me requires that I should remain at *location_mentioned*home*/location_mentioned*. I shall not be idle in your absence. The command therefore of the expedition agreebly to the militia law devolves upon *person_mentioned*Capt A. C. B [Aylett C. Buckner]*/person_mentioned* and the most prompt and attentive obedience to his orders is expected from all the *person_mentioned*officers */person_mentioned*and *person_mentioned*men */person_mentioned*composing the expedition.*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Mr. John C. Quick*/person_mentioned* has been appointed *person_mentioned*Adjutant */person_mentioned*during the expedition and it will be a part of his duty to drill the *person_mentioned*officers */person_mentioned*and *person_mentioned*men*/person_mentioned* and instruct them in their duty under the orders of the *person_mentioned*Commander*/person_mentioned* whenever it may be deemd necessary to do so—The utmost attention is necessary to this part of your duties—A body of armed *person_mentioned*men */person_mentioned* acting in union and with system are formidable, frequently irresistable and always prepared to act on the defensive, whilst the same body without discipline or system are incapable of acting efficiently on the offensive and fall an easy prey to an attacking force.*/p*
*p*Your own security, your own strength and your own interests therefore requires that you should patiently and attentively attend to drilling, and apply all your leisure moments on the march to this highly important and essential branch of your duty—I present the *person_mentioned*Adjutant */person_mentioned*to you recommended by a long course of practice in military duties both as an *person_mentioned*officer */person_mentioned*of the *location_mentioned*U. S*/location_mentioned*. *person_mentioned*regular army*/person_mentioned* and of *location_mentioned*U. S.*/location_mentioned* *person_mentioned*militia */person_mentioned*in active service, and also recommended as a man of honor and confidence and I feel no hesitation in believing that you will find him a valuable *person_mentioned*officer*/person_mentioned*—and that you will strictly attend to his instructions—a rigid obedience to orders is the basis of all military discipline and organization—The *person_mentioned*officers */person_mentioned*who command you are responsible for their conduct to their *person_mentioned*superior */person_mentioned*and their duty as well as their honor imperiously requires strictest obedience to the orders issued to them so also with the *person_mentioned*privates*/person_mentioned*, their duty as *person_mentioned*soldiers*/person_mentioned*, and their honor as such, as good *person_mentioned*citizens*/person_mentioned*, requires the most rigid attention and obedience or their part to the order they may receive from their *person_mentioned*officers*/person_mentioned*—*/p*
*p*This is the commencement of hostile movements on our part in the only war of any consequence we have had since our settlement in this *location_mentioned*country*/location_mentioned*, and I feel confident that your decisive conduct on this first expedition will so harrass our *person_mentioned*enemies */person_mentioned*that they will seek safety by humbling themselves and sue for peace—Much however very much depends on our first efforts—If we strike a decissive blow our future peace and security will probably be the result*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*friends */person_mentioned*and f—s I close by saying that your *person_mentioned*friends*/person_mentioned*, your *person_mentioned*officers*/person_mentioned*, and your *location_mentioned*country */location_mentioned*are confident that you will do your duty as *person_mentioned*soldiers*/person_mentioned* fighting in a just cause, their prairs and blessings therefore go with you—their welcome and thanks will hail your tryumphant return.*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*[Stephen F. Austin.]*/person_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
